title: Tunisia: 3 killed, 10 injured in attack near synagogue
description: The Tunisian Interior Ministry says a naval guard shot and killed a colleague and two civilians near a synagogue on the Tunisian island of Djerba during an annual Jewish pilgrimage

title: Ecuadoran lawmakers send President Lasso to impeachment
description: Guillermo Lasso, accused of embezzlement, denies wrongdoing; a legislative oversight commission has recommended against impeachment.

title: U.S., U.K. vow to aid Ukraine regardless of counteroffensive outcome
description: The top diplomats from the U.S. and Britain said they were committed to aiding Ukraine despite mounting questions about what its spring operation may achieve.

title: General who captured 'Che' Guevara buried without honors
description: The Bolivian general who captured Argentine-Cuban guerrilla leader Ernesto “Che” Guevara has been buried

title: Saudi Arabia, Syria to reopen embassies restoring relations
description: Saudi Arabia and Syria say their embbassies will resume work 11 years after they were closed as the two countries’ relations improve

title: Ecuador legislature moves forward on president's impeachment
description: Ecuador’s opposition-led National Assembly has voted to move forward with impeachment proceedings against President Guillermo Lasso over embezzlement allegations, while his defense team argues that the procedure violates the legislative body’s own rules

title: Passenger charged with hiding camera in cruise ship restroom
description: Officials say a passenger on a Caribbean cruise has been arrested after a hidden camera with video of dozens of people, including children, was discovered in a public restroom

title: Journalist working for AFP news agency killed in Ukraine
description: International news agency Agence France-Presse says its Ukraine video coordinator has been killed Tuesday during a rocket attack near the eastern Ukrainian city of Bakhmut

title: Russia's wildfire death toll rises to 21 in Ural Mountains
description: The death toll from wildfires in Russia’s Ural Mountains has risen to 21, according to Russian state news agency Tass

title: Gary Prado Salmón, Bolivian general who captured Ché Guevara, dies at 84
description: “I said, ‘Who are you?’” the officer recalled. “He said, ‘I am Ché. I am worth more to you alive than dead.’”

title: Greek police arrest 10, seize cocaine from banana shipment
description: Greek authorities say police have arrested 10 people for smuggling drugs from South America to Europe

title: Trial over deadly Istanbul bombing begins in Turkey
description: The trial has begun of 36 people accused of a deadly bombing in central Istanbul last November, in which six people were killed and 99 injured, Turkey’s state-run news agency reported

title: The pink river dolphins of the Amazon have a warning for humans
description: The beloved pink river dolphins are canaries in the Amazonian coal mine, warning of the threat the heavy metal poses to humans.

title: Syria: US strike on al-Qaida leader allegedly kills civilian
description: The U.S. military says it is investigating reports that it killed a civilian in a recent strike in northwest Syria that meant to target a senior al-Qaida leader

title: What to know as UK hosts Eurovision Song Contest for Ukraine
description: The Eurovision Song Contest is returning to the U.K. for the first time in 25 years, but its heart will be in Ukraine

title: Israeli security agency defends use of threatening messages
description: Israel’s Shin Bet internal security agency is defending its use of a surveillance tool that was used to send threatening text messages to Palestinian protesters at Jerusalem’s most sensitive holy site two years ago

title: Rita Lee, Brazil's long-reigning Queen of Rock, dies at 75
description: Rita Lee Jones, Brazil’s million-selling “Queen of Rock” who gained an international following through her colorful and candid style and such hits as “Ovelha Negra,” “Mania de Você” and “Now Only Missing You,” has died at 75

title: Spanish Civil Guard raid illegal wells amid drought
description: Spain’s Civil Guard says it has arrested 26 people in raids on illegal wells in the Andalusia region, as part of a widening crackdown on unauthorized water use amid a prolonged drought

title: Christie's sale of Austrian heiress' jewels stirs criticism
description: Christie’s is auctioning a staggering 700 pieces of jewelry from the collection of the late Heidi Horten, an Austrian heiress whose German husband built a retail empire starting in the 1930s — in part from department stores and other assets sold by desperate Jews as they fled Nazi Germany

title: Dozens injured in highway collision in eastern Germany
description: A highway collision between a long-distance bus and a truck has injured dozens of people in eastern Germany

title: Top Spanish court considers far-right challenge to LGBT law
description: Spain’s Constitutional Court will consider a legal challenge lodged by the far-right Vox party against a new law extending rights for transgender teenagers and encouraging tolerance for sexual diversity in schools

title: Sudan's death toll rises as warring sides continue talks
description: The death toll from the ongoing clashes in Sudan has risen to 604 people, including civilians

title: Rights group accuses Myanmar of using fuel-air explosive
description: Human Rights Watch has accused Myanmar’s military of using an “enhanced-blast” munition known as a fuel-air explosive in an airstrike that killed more than 160 people, including many children, at a ceremony held last month by opponents of army rule

title: Germany proposes rules to ease legal changes of gender
description: The German government has presented a proposal for a law that will make it easier for people to legally change their name and gender, ending decades-old rules that require them to get expert assessments and a court’s authorization

title: Germany saw more politically motivated crimes in 2022
description: The number of politically motivated crimes reported in Germany rose by 7% last year

title: China raids another global business consultancy, cites spying concerns
description: Capvision offices in four Chinese cities were raided by spy agencies and regulators. Experts say the crackdown is the result of worsening U.S.-China relations.

title: Party officials: Imran Khan arrested in court in Islamabad
description: Officials from the party of Pakistan’s former Prime Minister Imran Khan say he has been arrested as he appeared in a court in the capital, Islamabad, to face charges in multiple graft cases

title: Imran Khan, Pakistan opposition leader, arrested
description: Earlier attempts to arrest Imran Khan in March led to standoffs at his residence in Lahore.

title: Germany's Scholz urges EU to reform, strike migrants deal
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has called for the European Union to address the political, economic and strategic challenges it faces by embracing a series of reforms

title: Chinese woman appeals in fight for right to freeze her eggs
description: An unmarried Chinese woman has filed her final appeal of a hospital’s denial of access to freeze her eggs in a landmark case of female reproductive rights in the country

title: Ousted Caritas chief denounces Vatican 'power grab'
description: The recently ousted head of the Vatican’s main charitable organization is breaking six months of silence to denounce his removal as a “brutal power grab.”

title: EU, Ukraine together on Europe Day, but Kyiv remains outside
description: The European Union marks its annual Europe Day celebration of peace and unity with Ukraine anxiously looking in from the wings

title: Lost woman survives 5 days in the wild on a bottle of wine
description: Lillian Ip took a wrong turn and was stranded in the Australian wilderness. A teetotaler, she survived on a bottle of wine intended as a gift for her mother.

title: Ukraine live briefing: New missile strikes on Kyiv; Putin to mark Victory Day holiday in Moscow
description: A Kyiv official noted that the latest strikes came May 9, on Russia’s Victory Day holiday, and warned residents not to ignore air alarms.

title: In photos: Congo floods kill at least 400
description: One of the country’s deadliest recent disasters took place in the South Kivu province after heavy rainfall triggered flash floods and landslides.

title: Russia scales back Victory Day celebrations, fearing reprisals by Ukraine
description: Victory Day commemorates the defeat of Nazi Germany in what Russia calls the Great Patriotic War and normally features parades across the country.

title: Press group calls for Israeli accountability in media deaths
description: An international press-freedom group says the Israeli military has systematically evaded accountability in the deaths of 20 journalists over the past two decades

title: Killing of alleged collaborator exposes Palestinian tensions
description: The killing of 23-year-old Palestinian Zuhair al-Ghaleeth in West Bank city of Nablus on April 8 marked the first slaying of a suspected Israeli intelligence collaborator in nearly two decades

title: UN report: Female Afghan UN employees harassed, detained
description: The U.N. says some Afghan women employed by the United Nations have been detained, harassed and had restrictions placed on their movements since being banned by the Taliban from working for the world body

title: Killing of alleged collaborator exposes Palestinian tensions
description: The killing of 23-year-old Palestinian Zuhair al-Ghaleeth in West Bank city of Nablus on April 8 marked the first slaying of a suspected Israeli intelligence collaborator in nearly two decades

title: Toll of northeast India clashes now 60 dead, 35K displaced
description: Indian officials say security measures are keeping the peace in a remote northeastern state where 60 people were killed and 35,000 civilians were displaced by rioting and ethnic clashes last week

title: A year after journalist’s killing, report finds pattern of Israeli inaction
description: The killing of Shireen Abu Akleh, likely by an Israeli soldier, has become another example of Israel’s ability to sidestep accountability, according to a new report.

title: Asia’s heat waves are a grim sign of the times
description: A severe heat wave unfurling across a wide swath of Asia is a grim augur of things to come.
